Title: AI Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description:
Bist du bereit, die technologische Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten und deine Expertise einzubringen?

Hier übernimmst du eine Schlüsselrolle, in der du maßgeblich zum Erfolg des Unternehmens beiträgst. Du bist nicht nur Entwickler*in, sondern auch Visionär*in und Team-Player*in. Wenn du eine Passion für Technologie hast, strategisch denkst und Lust hast, ein Produkt von Grund auf mitzugestalten, dann haben wir die passende Stelle für dich bei unseren Partner mit Sitz in München und Berlin. Es handelt sich dabei um ein innovatives Beratungs- und Trainingsunternehmen, das sich auf die Einführung und Umsetzung von generativer KI in Unternehmen spezialisiert hat.




Was du erwarten darfst




Eine unbefristete Festanstellung in Vollzeit
Dich erwartet ein großer Gestaltungsspielraum mit freier Hand bei der Umsetzung eigener Ideen in einem dynamischen Umfeld und mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Du arbeitest in einem dynamischen Startup-Flair, in dem deine Expertise direkten Einfluss auf den Unternehmenserfolg hat – in einem kreativen und motivierten Team
Flexible Arbeitsbedingungen sind gegeben, inklusive der Möglichkeit zum Remote-Arbeiten (Hybrid)
Es gibt vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung in einem zukunftsorientierten Bereich







Deine Aufgaben




Du verfügst über tiefgehende Erfahrung in der Microsoft-Umgebung und bringst fundierte Kenntnisse mit Copilot Studio, Azure Open AI sowie Power Automate mit
Du entwickelst schnell und hands-on innovative Prototypen, wobei du deine Expertise im Bereich Machine Learning sowie in Programmiersprachen wie Python einbringst
Wenn erforderlich, unterstützt du als technischer Trainer – von Entwickler zu Entwickler – und führst Trainings oder Workshops durch, Erfahrungen in diesem Bereich sind wünschenswert
Du platzierst aktiv Lösungen beim Kunden, wirst in Projekte eingebunden und entwickelst interne Produkte mit. Dabei scheust du dich nicht, in kritischen Situationen dort mit anzupacken, wo Unterstützung gebraucht wird, zum Beispiel bei Entwickler-AI Trainings







Dein Profil

Du hast tiefgehende Erfahrung in der Microsoft-Umgebung, inklusive Erfahrungen mit Copilot Studio, Azure Open AI und Power Automate
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen sind für dich selbstverständlich, wobei Python essenziell ist. Erfahrungen mit weiteren Sprachen wie C# im Microsoft-Umfeld und der Umgang mit Machine Learning Frameworks, zum Beispiel TensorFlow oder PyTorch, sind von Vorteil
Die Fähigkeit, schnell und hands-on Prototypen zu entwickeln, zeichnet dich aus
Erfahrung als technischer Trainer oder in der Durchführung von Entwickler-Trainings und Workshops ist wünschenswert
Die Bereitschaft, aktiv beim Kunden Lösungen zu platzieren und in Projekten mitzuwirken, bringst du mit
Eine ausgeprägte Hands-On-Mentalität und Teamgeist sind für dich selbstverständlich

Title: Junior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Junior Data Scientist to join our international and dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionise the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com. Our team is divided accordingly based on the 3 brands and here at Auto1.com we focus on the sale to professional dealers. We are dedicated to leverage curing-edge technology to develop Machine learning solutions that optimize our Auto1.com sales and processes.

As a Junior data scientist, you will take part in developing innovative machine learning models that address a variety of challenges such as dynamic pricing based on market demands on Auto1.com platform, creating personalized recommendations for dealers, optimizing sales representatives calling priorities and forecasting demands on Auto1.com platform to make purchasing pricing decisions. We also tackle technical implementation such as feature stores as internal support for the entire data science department. We are excited to work with talented contributors. Join us in shaping the future of automotive dealer sales with machine learning solutions!

Job Description


Assist in translating business needs into data science questions and contribute to the research and development of Machine Learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Work collaboratively with engineering and product teams to support the deployment of data science solutions and their integration into the Auto1 technology infrastructure.
Monitor the performance of models in production, prepare reports for stakeholders and assist in developing actionable next steps under guidance.
Learn from senior team members, follow best practices and actively contribute to achieving project goals as part of a collaborative team


Qualifications


A university degree in STEM fields or a prior work experience in data analytics and data science
Knowledge in machine learning algorithms on supervised and unsupervised learning
Demonstration of hands-on experience with SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud and experience in Github or Git is a plus.
Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
Strong communication and visualisation skills to effectively present findings in a clear and concise manner.


Additional Information


Working from home: you can work from home up to 5 days a week
International team with flat hierarchies and open communication
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Regular knowledge sharing session within team on various topics
Exciting team events every quarter
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Marija Dimitrova

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Pricing)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (all genders) to join our "Data Science Pricing" squad in Logistics on our journey to deliver amazing experiences. Pricing is one of the most impactful levers in our business—and you’ll be shaping how it works across dozens of markets and millions of customers. In this role, you’ll tackle a wide range of pricing-related challenges—from developing intelligent pricing algorithms to advancing our experimentation techniques. You will support other Data Scientists in delivering high-quality solutions, challenge assumptions, and help raise the bar for data science practices across our teams.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll work closely with multiple cross-functional teams to build and maintain scalable, reliable machine learning services deployed globally.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who’s eager to make an impact, an international workplace awaits you in the heart of Berlin!

Our pricing systems operate at the heart of a fast-moving, global food delivery business—directly influencing customer experience and company performance.

Your mission:


Design and implement automation and experimentation algorithms for pricing, from conception to production.
Take technical ownership and uphold high quality standards within the team. Mentor junior team members.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary stakeholders and translate business needs into data science solutions.
Stay up to date with the latest research and suggest state-of-the-art models to improve customer outcomes.
Contribute to long-term strategic planning and defining a short-term roadmap to tackle complex and meaningful data problems.
Most importantly: You’re excited to build global systems affecting millions of customers, and you continuously drive for excellence.


Qualifications


Solid statistical skills—you’re confident with fundamentals and first-principles thinking in statistics and machine learning theory.
Strong engineering background—you write clean, maintainable Python code and SQL queries, following best practices for production systems.
Deep expertise in at least one relevant domain (e.g., causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, neural networks, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, advanced experimentation).
Thoughtful approach—you challenge assumptions and care deeply about working with clean, trustworthy data.
Substantial experience in a business environment where you developed a strong business understanding.
Clear communicator—you can distill complex requirements from many stakeholders into a clear, MVP-ready direction.
You value agile processes, data-driven development, reliability, and rigorous experimentation.


Nice to have:


Experience in pricing or food delivery business.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

As part of your application and interview process, your capability will be assessed against the Government Digital and Data Capability Framework. Depending on your assessed level of capability you may be eligible for a salary from January '26 of £41,100 if you are assessed as 'Developing', rising to £44,400 for an 'Accomplished' rating.

Salary for SEO Senior Data Scientists: £46,058 - £57,400. This role is eligible for the Government Digital and Data Capability Framework, please see the candidate pack for more information.

Qualifications

A degree in a discipline with numerical or statistical elements; OR equivalent experience. For SEO, you will need a degree in a discipline with numerical or statistical elements; OR demonstrable portfolio of data science and machine learning.

Title: Associate Data Scientist, Growth Analytics
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Business Analytics team at Spotify. You will work with the Growth Analytics Lead to evaluate and influence our global growth strategy. You will collaborate with a distributed team of world-class analysts, data scientists, business leaders, marketers, and engineers. Learning and improving is part of our daily routine, and you will get a platform to develop your data skills and carve out efficient ways of working.

The Business Analytics team is part of Spotify’s core business strategy organization. You’ll play a crucial role in the growth and direction of Spotify as we grow to 700M+ users around the globe. At your fingertips, you’ll have access to all of the data Spotify has to offer, and the opportunity to be creative with how you use it to derive insights and strategies. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences audio!

What You'll Do


Develop data driven strategies to drive the growth of Spotify users and subscribers
Design and implement comprehensive tests, making sure that we track all relevant metrics and that we’re learning at every step along the way
Create and communicate impactful recommendations and models that improve our product offering, user messaging, and channel optimization
Build scalable data pipelines and dashboards to facilitate business performance tracking
Work closely with business partners to understand the change they are driving and help them discover new opportunities for growth
Present your findings to senior collaborators, influencing the course of our business


Who You Are


Recently completed Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or other relevant field
Experience synthesizing insights from data using tools such as Python/R and SQL
Intellectually curious, creative, and diligent - you enjoy thinking about the business as much as about the data
Comfortable using AI-powered tools to accelerate analysis and improve productivity
Comfortable working on a globally distributed team (with occasional international travel)


Where You'll Be


This role is based in London
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Data Scientist (Battery Storage)
Description:
Company Description

Masdar is the UAE’s clean energy champion and one of the largest companies of its kind in the world, advancing the development and deployment of renewable energy and green hydrogen technologies to address global sustainability challenges. Established in 2006, Masdar is today active in over 40 countries, helping them to achieve their clean energy objectives and advance sustainable development.

Masdar is jointly owned by Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC), Mubadala Investment Company (Mubadala), and Abu Dhabi National Energy Company (TAQA), and under this ownership the company is targeting a renewable energy portfolio capacity of at least 100 gigawatts (GW) by 2030 and an annual green hydrogen production capacity of up to 1 million tonnes by the same year.

Job Description

Purpose for the Job:

To play a pivotal role in enhancing the performance, reliability, and profitability of our renewable energy assets. To leverage advanced analytics, machine learning, and data visualization techniques by driving data-driven strategies to optimize operations (and maintenance), forecast performance, and support strategic decision-making aligned with our goals.

To work in close interface with Commercial Team supporting overall development of a data platform for Masdar’s London managed projects with a key ambition to set up a BESS Operations Control Desk. This desk will be responsible for the monitoring, analysis & scheduling of all assets and act as the key interface between all stakeholders (Masdar, O&M contractors, DNO, OEM and Optimiser). The Data Scientist will play a pivotal role in enabling this.

Job Responsibilities:


Work in cooperation with Commercial team on development of Data Platform.
Integrate asset data into the platform and build new visualization and management tools.
Integrate all BESS data (financial and technical) and develop Asset Management tools and dashboards.
Document control management.


Collaborate with the Masdar Control Desk to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and areas for improvement:


Support the Control Desk in their data and analysis needs to optimise battery availability and state of health.
Creation and continued refinement of key dashboard tools used for portfolio management.
Automate Battery scheduling and technical reporting
Work with our cyber security partners to enhance protection of both our assets and data platform.
Support on work to implement our BESS Cyber Security Policy, and Cyber Security in OFSW as appropriate
Support on progressing towards full CAF and ENA DER Compliance.


Asset Management data analysis and performance optimisation:


Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance asset efficiency, reduce asset downtime and maximize commercial performance.
Create intuitive dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders, including the asset management and commercial team.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to support operational and strategic decisions.


Data Maintenance:


Collect, clean, and process large datasets from various sources, including SCADA systems, IoT devices, and historical records.
Ensure data integrity, consistency, and availability for analysis and reporting.


Comply with information security policies, procedures and requirements at all times:


Adhere to any applicable Masdar information security policies and procedures and identify and report security incidents and suspected weaknesses to the appropriate point(s) of contact.
Protect assets under care (e.g. laptops and other devices) and information/credentials against unauthorized access, sharing, and/or damage/loss, in accordance with the Information Classification and Handling Procedure.
Clear desks of all sensitive material and log off/ lock workstations at the end of the day and when leaving desk for a prolonged period in accordance with Acceptable Usage Policies.
Ensure not installing, copying or modifying of any software on Masdar equipment without authorization.


Qualifications

Qualifications, Experience, & Skills

Preferred Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.


Preferred Experience:


Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong knowledge of time-series analysis, predictive modelling, and machine learning techniques.
Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., SQL) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).


Job-Specific Skills:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.
Proactive mindset with a passion for renewable energy and sustainability.
A team player and attention to detail


Additional Information

Please note: All Applicants must be based in the UK.

Masdar is one of the world’s fastest growing renewable energy companies and a green hydrogen leader, placing the UAE at the forefront of the energy transition.

As a pioneer in advancing the clean energy sector and a key enabler of the UAE’s vision as a global leader in sustainability and climate action, Masdar has developed projects in more than 40 countries across six continents and has invested, or committed to invest, in worldwide projects with a combined value of more than US$30 billion.

Masdar unites the UAE’s three energy champions – Mubadala, ADNOC and TAQA – and will utilize their combined expertise to fulfill its purpose as a global clean energy pioneer across renewables and green hydrogen.

Promoting innovation in solar, wind, energy storage, waste-to-energy, and geothermal energy, Masdar has a proven record of delivering pioneering projects using cutting-edge clean energy technologies, that are commercially viable and bankable.

Masdar will use your personal information in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice, which provides details on the purposes for which your data is processed.

Checkout.com is one of the most exciting fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy. We’re the strategic payments partner for some of the best known fast-moving brands globally such as Wise, Hut Group, Sony Electronics, Homebase, Henkel, Klarna and many others. Purpose-built with performance and scalability in mind, our flexible cloud-based payments platform helps global enterprises launch new products and create experiences customers love. And it's not just what we build that makes us different. It's how.

We empower passionate problem-solvers to collaborate, innovate and do their best work. That’s why we’re number 9 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list and on Glassdoor’s list of Top 10 fintechs to work for. And we’re just getting started. We’re building diverse and inclusive teams around the world — because that’s how we create even better experiences for our merchants and our partners. And we need your help. So, join us to build tomorrow, today.

Job Description

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the development of scalable systems that power real-time fraud detection and payment optimization. This is your opportunity to grow alongside top-tier engineers while making a tangible impact on millions of transactions globally.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How You’ll Make An Impact


Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in our payments platform, at scale
Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
Deliver end to end features with full ownership under mentorship of talented engineers


Qualifications


Proficiency in writing clear, production-ready Python code
Familiarity with production ML models (online or offline) and standard MLOps practices
Familiarity with monitoring and observability of production systems, with a strong sense of ownership
Familiarity in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)
Familiarity with one or more ML frameworks and technologies: scikit-learn, xgboost, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, Databricks, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow, Seldon, Triton
Strong communication skills, able to express ideas clearly and collaborate across teams
Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
Curiosity to tackle open-ended problems and learn from failures

Our clients come from all over the world — and so do we. Hiring hard-working people and giving them a community to thrive in is critical to our success.

Title: Junior Data Scientist  – Early Career Program
Description:
This Is What We Offer You


Gross monthly salary between €3,314 and €4,733 (scale 07)
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
10% Employee Benefit Budget
EUR 1,400 development budget per year
Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


Or view all our benefits.

Junior Data Scientist – Data & analytics Early Career Program

Are you passionate about data and love solving complex analytical puzzles? Challenge yourself and us, and make an impact with the Data & Analytics Early Career Program at Rabobank. Grow your skills, discover your potential, and help us uncover new possibilities for Rabobank.

The role

As a Junior Data Scientist Transaction Monitoring you can have social impact, by catching the criminals using analytics models to analyze Rabobank transactions of 8+ million customers.

Preventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing are one of the key aspects for our society and our organization, and as a bank we play a major role in this field. In order to be effective in fighting financial crime, we need talented individuals like yourself who get their energy from looking into data, patterns and behavior of our customers to uncover illegal activities. In a multi-disciplinary team filled with smart and driven colleagues from a variety of nationalities you will work on optimizing our Transaction Monitoring (TM) model and TM system. As you can imagine, doing this job requires statistical, investigative and analytical expertise and if done successfully, will make sure that our analysts are able to focus on the true positive alerts – hence spend their time on truly value-adding activities. In summary, in this role you will be on the front line of fighting financial crime.

Practical Examples


Do you want to help us catch even more types of suspicious behavior? Collaborate with Anti Money Laundering (AML) experts, dive into our analytics environment (Databricks) and identify unusual patterns in our data.
Do you want to see your code in production? Learn how to write production-ready code (Python, PySpark) and optimize its performance.
Do you want to help us increase the potential of our TM system? Investigate how new data sources can be integrated into our data model or expand on the functionality of our model components.
Do you want to learn and share knowledge? Participate in our knowledge sharing sessions, present your work to fellow data scientists, and pick the brain of your colleagues.
Do you want to be a part of our team? Join us while we work towards the same goals, learn from our mistakes, and celebrate our successes.


You and your future

During our Early Career Program, you’ll develop your career over 18 months by becoming an expert in your field. Throughout the program, you’ll stay with one team and receive training to enhance your hard skills. You’ll be paired with a buddy who will guide you in navigating the bank. For your personal development, you and your fellow starters will follow the Early Career Program and receive guidance from a Data & Analytics Development Consultant. We’re here to prepare you for sustainable career!

Practical


Length: 18 months, after which you will continue working within your team
Hours per week: 40 About 10-15% of your weekly working time is spent on personal development, training and other activities. The other hours are spent working within your team;
Every Friday afternoon is Data & Analytics Early Career Program  afternoon at the office! 


Your development as a Young Professional

Within this program, you will have the opportunity to get to know yourself, your trade, and Rabobank. You will start the program in a junior position within one team, participate in (online) workshops and training modules with other young professionals, and quickly gain practical experience.

Together with Data & Analytics community there is room for creativity and initiative to organize events, training sessions, and knowledge-sharing sessions. This way, we continuously improve the program and ourselves! You will easily build a large and valuable network within the bank.

Work on your own development & shape the world around you

Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science solutions in the RBC Chief Audit Executive (CAE) Group. Data Science allows us to better understand the implications of what information means, identify trends, anticipate future behaviors, perform pattern matching that leads to a future decision and predict the outcomes of future events and violations. Our group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Leveraging leading edge technologies and capabilities, we apply machine learning and statistical modelling techniques to help auditors understand the changing risk environment, while building tools to bring this information to their fingertips.

What will you do?


Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and build solutions using advanced machine learning methods and Generative AI in the domain of risk and compliance.
Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: from data cleaning to model development to writing production level code.
Implement supervised and unsupervised machine learning models, data mining methods, statistical analysis, and pipelines to prepare and integrate various data types and sources.
Quickly learn new methods, tools and technologies presented in research communities to implement and adapt within our ecosystem and models.
Collaborate proactively with various business and operation units to design innovative solutions to optimize processes and deploy production-scale solutions.
Work on challenging and research-based initiatives using advanced machine learning methods focusing on tangible outcomes.
Prototype and build Generative AI tools to augment our internal processes and drive efficiencies.


What do you need to succeed?

Must Have


At least an undergraduate degree (PhD. or Masters preferred) in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Sociology, Psychology etc.).
Advanced programming skills (python, pyspark) and experience in developing machine learning models using supervised and unsupervised approaches; experience with data preprocessing, feature and representation learning, anomaly/outlier detection.
Curiosity, strong data sense, critical thinking, and technical documentation skills.
A passion for simplifying and automating work, making things better, continuous learning, solving open-ended problems, improving efficiency, and helping others.
Strong communication skills with ability to work cross-functionally to articulate, measure and solve issues.


Nice to Have


Comfortable using state of the art frameworks such as Langgraph and Llamaindex.


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About mytorso.ai

mytorso.ai is an ambitious early-stage digital health startup based in the vibrant tech hub of Vancouver, BC. We are on a mission to empower individuals to optimize their resilience and overall wellness by delivering holistic, data-driven insights that connect breath form, core stability, and nervous system regulation. We achieve this by combining our proprietary wearable technology with industry-leading wellness wearables, health apps, and cutting-edge AI, we offer data-driven feedback and highly personalized plans that help users thrive.




We are passionate about harnessing technology to unlock new potentials in human wellness. If you're looking to join a company that's making a real difference in people's lives and want to gain hands-on startup experience from experienced innovators, we encourage you to apply!




Position Overview

mytorso.ai seeks a talented, motivated Intermediate Data Scientist enthusiastic about leveraging Generative AI to accelerate development and unlock new possibilities in health data analysis. You will be pivotal in developing our platform's core intelligence, starting with an initial area of focus on transforming raw sensor data from our wearable into meaningful, breath form classifications and personalized breath signatures.

Subsequently, your expertise will be crucial for creating a holistic wellness platform. This will involve integrating data from various wearables and health apps, and developing an AI Agent with conversational capabilities to enable intuitive, user-led exploration of aggregated health data.

This is a unique chance to contribute to foundational areas of development, build core technology, and grow your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment.




What You'll Do:

End-to-End Model Development: Design, develop, train, validate, and deploy robust machine learning models for time-series classification, anomaly detection, and pattern recognition, specifically tailored to physiological sensor data (e.g., breath mechanics, core stability signals).
Data Pipeline & Feature Engineering: Develop and refine data preprocessing pipelines for ingesting, cleaning, and preparing large volumes of proprietary and third-party sensor data. Engineer and select impactful features from raw data streams to optimize model performance and extract meaningful physiological insights.
Holistic Platform Development: Contribute to the design of data aggregation and normalization strategies for the holistic Wellness platform, integrating data from diverse commercial wearables and health applications.
AI Agent & Conversational Interface Development: Design, develop, and refine components of an AI Agent, including its conversational interface (leveraging NLP and dialogue management), to enable intuitive, user-led exploration and understanding of aggregated health data.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, and health science teams to define data requirements, translate complex problems into data science solutions, and integrate models into our platform.
Insight Generation & Communication: Analyze data to uncover actionable insights and trends. Clearly document methodologies, experiments, and results, and effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Continuous Learning & Innovation: Stay current with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, signal processing, wearable technology, AI agents, and GenAI, particularly within the digital health domain, and proactively identify opportunities for innovation.




Who You Are:

Education & Experience: Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Biomedical Engineering with 3+ years of demonstrable hands-on experience in data science or machine learning roles, including a proven record of developing and deploying ML/AI models.
Python & Data Science Ecosystem: Strong proficiency in Python and its core data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Machine Learning Expertise: Solid experience with a range of machine learning algorithms (especially for time-series analysis, classification, and signal processing), robust feature engineering techniques, and comprehensive model evaluation methodologies.
AI Agent / Conversational AI Knowledge: Experience or strong foundational knowledge in developing AI agents, conversational AI systems, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and dialogue management.
Cloud Experience: Proficiency in developing and deploying ML/AI on cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOps principles.
Data Handling & Pipelines: Proven experience in developing data preprocessing pipelines and working with complex, potentially noisy, sensor data.
Generative AI Acumen: Demonstrated interest and practical experience of leveraging GenAI tools to enhance data science workflows.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Prowess: A strong analytical mindset with the ability to tackle complex, ill-defined problems, critically evaluate data, and derive actionable insights.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to diverse audiences. A collaborative team player who thrives in an agile startup environment.
Adaptability & Initiative: A proactive learner who quickly adapts to new technologies and methodologies, and takes initiative to drive projects forward.




Desirable Skills (Nice-to-Haves):

Experience working directly with physiological sensor data (e.g., ECG, PPG, EMG, accelerometer, gyroscope).
Previous experience in the digital health, wellness, or health tech industry.




Why Join mytorso.ai?

Make a Real Impact: Contribute to a product significantly improving health and well-being.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with proprietary wearable tech, advanced AI/ML, and leverage GenAI in digital health.
Foundational Role: Join a passionate founding team; your work directly shapes our product and culture.
Growth & Learning: Unparalleled opportunities for professional growth and increasing responsibilities.
Collaborative & Innovative Culture: We foster open communication, collaboration, and continuous innovation.
